data.title: The Wall Street Journal: Facebook will run a Super Bowl commercial for the first time
data.text: Facebook Inc. will run its first commercial in the Super Bowl, buying time for a 60-second ad featuring Chris Rock and Sylvester Stallone to promote its Groups feature, a company spokeswoman said.

data.title: Facebook's Libra Won't Launch Any Time Soon, Says David Kirkpatrick
data.text: David Kirkpatrick, Techonomy founder, and Michael Levine, Pivotal Research Analyst, talk about the challenges facing Facebook in 2020.

data.title: Off the charts: Is Facebook heading higher?
data.text: Chris Verrone, Strategas Research Partners, with his call on Facebook. With CNBC's Brian Sullivan and the Fast Money traders, Pete Najarian, Tim Seymour, Karen Finerman and Steve Grasso.

data.title: Facebook buys cloud-gaming startup
data.text: Facebook Inc. has acquired a Spanish startup focused on cloud delivery of video games, according to reports.

data.title: Facebook acquires Spanish cloud video gaming company PlayGiga
data.text: Facebook has acquired PlayGiga, a Madrid company that specializes in cloud gaming.

data.title: Facebook Faces Off With Regulators in 2019
data.text: Bloomberg's Taylor Riggs looks back at Facebook's year in which it kept facing off with regulators and politicians.

data.title: Opinion: Facebook, Google and Twitter's political ad policies are bad for democracy
data.text: As the 2020 election nears, the big three social media companies have been scrambling to solidify their approaches to political advertising.

data.title: Why this investing pro says investors should pick Facebook over Twitter
data.text: Katie Stockton of Fairlead Strategies and John Petrides of Tocqueville Asset Management discuss whether investors should pick Facebook or Twitter with CNBC's Mike Santoli.

data.title: Here are AlphaOne founding partner Dan Niles' favorite tech stocks
data.text: Dan Niles, AlphaOne Capital's founding partner, joins "Squawk Alley" via phone to discuss which stocks were his favorite in 2019.

data.title: Political rifts Peter Thiel is causing aren't new, says reporter
data.text: The Wall Street Journal says a rift has developed among senior leaders at Facebook over how to respond to criticism of the company's impact on U.S.politics. According to the Wall Street Journal, Facebook's first major outside investor Peter Thiel is at the center of the debate.

data.title: The Best Value Stock to Buy in December
data.text: Looking for a bargain in the current high-priced market? Then take a look at this social media company.

data.title: How Facebook’s like button hijacked our attention and broke the 2010s
data.text:
What began as a simple way to show appreciation online has become the social currency of the decade, and there may be no going back. 
The change was subtle but consequential.

data.title: Fed's Brainard: Facebook's Libra faces 'core set' of regulatory hurdles
data.text: U.S. Federal Reserve Governor Lael Brainard launched a broadside against Facebook's Libra digital currency project on Wednesday, saying it faces a "core set of legal and regulatory challenges" including clarity about how it would be tied to some basket of underlying assets.
